intro: Gomidesia affinis var. catharinensis, commonly known as the Catharinense Gomidesia, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to white. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
